Articles.Content:
I tested the robotic arms for station. The arms themselves work fine, but the magnets on JEM and RMS(Canadarm2) don't work. I haven't tested the shuttle arm yet though.

do you have the option to turn on and off (right click on the tip)

I haven't tried yet.

and you need kerbal attachment system if you don't have it.

I will look more into it.

also did some edits and the RO config works now
Yes, I have both KAS and KIS installed, and I do have the option to toggle the magnet. It just has no effect.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/q67t4wh3zjhvbih/RO_ISS.cfg?dl=0

link to fixed config

https://www.dropbox.com/s/q67t4wh3zjhvbih/RO_ISS.cfg?dl=0

link to fixed config

Cheers!

Cheers!

I apologize for the issues. I had to update mods to get the issue.

but thanks for the help in fixing the bug
Now it does this >_>

Issue with Iss: Unity (node 1) and Harmony/Tranquility (node 2-3) models are inverted. Unity is smaller than Harmony and Tranquility, and in your pack it's bigger.

This should be the correct configuration

http://imgur.com/a/FRrOb

with current node 1 as Harmony/Tranquility and Node 2/3 as Unity. But they both need retexturing, as node 2/3 has "Unity" written on it and Node 1 doesn't have "Unity" written on it.

Photos for reference: ("Unity" should be written close to PMA and Zarya, with the berthing ports in the other half of the module)

http://www.esa.int/var/esa/storage/images/esa_multimedia/images/2001/11/zarya_and_unity_artist_s_view/9126003-5-eng-GB/Zarya_and_Unity_Artist_s_view_node_full_image_2.jpg

http://www.logosinspace.com/images/NASA-Images/Unity%20Emblem/AZ%20Produced%20Unity%20Embelm%20on%20First%20US%20Module%20of%20International%20Space%20Station%20Attached%20to%20Russian%20Zarya%20Control%20Module%20Against%20Earth's%20Horizon%20STS088%20600X400.jpg

Another thing: I would really like an assembly guide, especially for the truss sections. I know, as an ISS enthusiast, the chronology of the modules, but I need a guide to assembly your model, as when I try to build it some pieces seem badly positioned. For example, s0 structures are floating in the air, when I come back home i'll post screenshots

I see what you mean about the texture issues. but for now I am sorting through my mistakes and checking fitments.

that truss mount on S0 was designed when I thaught there were no dock ports between them. so I will remodel

I will make an assembly guide when I have time free and don't have urgent fixes to do

- - - Updated - - -

Now it does this >_>

wow. I am currently in game...

in thruster block now.

checking

- - - Updated - - -

N2O4 not found in resource database. Propellant Setup has failed.

I cant find any traces of this anymore.

is there a chance you have a duplicate RO config in another location somewhere?

- - - Updated - - -

SovietPack/Parts/MIR/MIR_RCS/part/Mir_RCS_ThrusterBlock'

N2O4 not found in resource database. Propellant Setup has failed.

- - - Updated - - -

check to see there are no RO patches in the ISS_Comunity and SovietPack folders

also make sure to delete RO_ISS (and RO_ISS_2 if you have) from gamedata/realismoverhaul/RO_SugestedMods

then install that patch I gave you to gamedata/realismoverhaul/RO_SugestedMods

in thruster block now.

is there a chance you have a duplicate RO config in another location somewhere?

N2O4 not found in resource database. Propellant Setup has failed.

- - - Updated - - -

check to see there are no RO patches in the ISS_Comunity and SovietPack folders

also make sure to delete RO_ISS (and RO_ISS_2 if you have) from gamedata/realismoverhaul/RO_SugestedMods

then install that patch I gave you to gamedata/realismoverhaul/RO_SugestedMods

Yeah, having a duplicate was the problem.

Now it works tho.

*sigh of relief*

I am working through issues with fitment issues and whatnot.

keep me up to date if there are resize problems or whatever

Any idea what the problem with the arm magnets might be... If you think it might be a cfg problem I could try to fix it... Although I will admit I would have no clue what I'm doing... But I could give it a try.
best bet would be to look at an existing mod that works and copy it over...
That would be my guess... If you want I can try it when I get home from work and let you know if it works...
yup. thanks. I cant stay awake tonight..(4am) back to it tomorrow.
It's noon here, so I've got plenty of time to check it later...
nither canadarm2, jem, nor jeasts arm can grab parts... i did test the kas magnet part itself though, that works....

nither canadarm2, jem, nor jeasts arm can grab parts... i did test the kas magnet part itself though, that works....

Will look at it shortly. May need a remodel of the tip. Will post when ready.

Today im going over the iss RO configs. Update it later also
Have you done any work on the Dreamchaser? I still can't get it to dock and it still doesn't have lateral RCS thrusters (even though the textures on the large-size model show their presence).

sorry, have been working on this:

Ah yeah! You made me happy!

sorry, have been working on this:

- - - Updated - - -

I think the dreamer will need modulercsfx mod

Good god D:

Oh, that's so pretty... but probably way beyond my poor machine's abilities.

But in the meantime, could I get an attachment node added to the top of the JEM ELM-PS? The CG is too far off the CT when I try to launch it already mounted. This would let me launch the JEM pressurized section in two main parts, rather than one. Once the arm grapplers work, I'll be able to add the exposed parts.

- - - Updated - - -

And gotcha on the Dreamer. I know Mechjeb doesn't do well with spaceplanes, but maybe a once-over to get a more stable ascent? No hurry, though. I'll probably use Soyuz or Orion capsules for crew launches.
